## Notes
* Statistical learning - set of tools for understanding data,  
    * Supervised - using statistical models to predict or estimate outputs based on a set of inputs  
    * Unsupervised - evaluating relationships and data structure using only inputs  
* Types of input and output  
    * Categorical data -qualitative  
    * Continuous data - quantitative  
* book based on four premises  
    1. Statistical learning methods broadly applicable  
    2. Statistical learning not a set of black boxes  
    3. Important to understand methods, not necessarily be able to construct methods  
    4. Application of statistical learning to real-world problems  
* See pages 9 - 12 for information on notation used in book  
* Table 1.1 page 14 summaary of datasets used in book
